text: You can preset the background colors/ images for sections, columns, rows in a template. Here are docs on how to do so: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/tags/dnd-areas#background-image>
Thanks Chris :pray:

No problem! If you’re taking the pseudo element approach, you’ll most likely want to set a background color for a specific section in the template (using the approach that I linked to), and then add pseudo elements in your stylesheet. However, the current drawback to that approach is that a customer won’t have the ability to update the psuedo element colors the same way that they update the section background in the editor, so the section background settings and the pseudo element style may become disconnected.
It’d be awesome to be able to add a class to the dnd_section in the template and the UI
That’s a great request. Do you feel that the class should be available to be edited/ added at the page level as well?
yes - so the user can order the slices as they see fit
ideally I’d actually be able to add an option to the dnd_section - i.e. “Slice direction”
Ah okay, so rather than custom classes, you’d ideally like to have custom options for a section that a customer can control.
Even if it translated to an auto generated class (i.e. slice-direction--VALUE) I’d be able to hook in the CSS for a bunch of different things I’d like to support for users
exactly
A class would be a good stop gap but definitely not the ideal solution
Being able to create a custom module that wrapped dnd_section would probably be the most logical and flexible option

That’s great feedback. I’m going to report back to the team with that request.
Please continue to ask questions and give us feedback like this as we are excited to continue to improve the product. I can’t make any promises that we’ll be able to implement exactly what you’re asking, but we do want to take these types of issues into account.

For sure! I’m building my first HubSpot theme for a client and I’m running into things I’d like to do, but can’t, and things that aren’t as clear as they should be. If you’d like I can gather them up and I’d be happy to do a call with you or someone else on the team to give a whole bunch of feedback.
That would be great! Please feel free to reach out to me directly and I will report back to our team with your questions/ issues.
Sounds good :slightly_smiling_face:
